a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Disease burden from non-communicable diseases, World, 1990 to
Total disease burden from non-communicable diseases (NCDs), measured in DALYs (Disability-Adjusted Life Years) per
year. DALYs are used to measure total burden of disease - both from years of life lost and years lived with a disability. One
DALY equals one lost year of healthy life.
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024)
